script.dialog: \E(2)Hello there, Little Robot.
Hello, young Zaraden.|L||!|This Unit is programmed to provide information to anyone who might need it.
Okay!      What do you have for me?
This Unit will now teach this Zaraden how to love the monsters.
\E(2)That is perfect!\E(0)     I was just wondering about how to do that.
In order to teach this Zaraden how to love the monsters, This Unit will now emulate an unloved monster.
To accomplish this, |C3|fear|C0| must be installed onto This Unit.
This Unit will now run |C3|Existential_Dread.prog|C0|
That doesn't sound very good.
|C3|Installing       .       .       .|L||!|Complete.|C0|
Are you okay?
This Unit has just installed 2,700 units of |C3|fear|C0| onto her system.
|C2|Moving Happiness.prog to the Trash Folder. |!||L|Deleting the Trash Folder.
Don't do that!
|C2|Nobody loves me, but it doesn't matter because the universe is an uncaring void.
|shake|Why would you say that?
This Unit would like to apologize.|!||L|That was a minor side effect of having |C3|fear|C0| installed onto This Unit.
Please ignore any |C3|fear|C0| induced speech errors that may occur in the future.
Okay...   If you say so.
|C3|Suggestion:|C0| Use your abilities to remove the |C3|fear|C0| that has been installed onto This Unit.
How do I do that?
|C3|Step One:|C0| Close your eyes and think of something lovely.
\E(2)Easy!      What's next?
|C3|Step Two: |C2||shake|I will feel better after hurting you!
